location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

mods.abstract: Enclosure No. 3 to Despatch No. 14 from the Secret Department, Bombay Castle, dated 27 March 1860. The Enclosure is dated 11 February 1860. Received 30 April 1860.The Enclosure consists of a report from the Commander in Chief of the Indian Navy, Commodore George Greville Wellesley, concerning the efficiency of gunboats that were required to be built by the Indian Navy, with particular reference to HM Gun Boat Clyde. A note on the verso of the last folio of the Enclosure states that the report gives further evidence of the superiority of a fast light steam sloop to a gunboat for service at Zanzibar.
